document.title: Output Buffering Functions
document.synopsis: These functions that allow capturing output. These were inspired by php's ob_* series of functions.
document.todo: Rename to ob_? There is more than one kind of buffer.
document.section: This actually only uses one buffer, but allows for multiple buffers by keeping a stack of the length of that buffer each time a new one is started.

function.name: end
function.synopsis: Ends the current output buffer and prints the contents of the buffer
function.note: Does nothing if no buffers are active

function.name: end_all
function.synopsis: Ends all output buffers and prints their contents
function.note: Does nothing if no buffers are active

function.name: end_clean
function.synopsis: Ends the current output buffer and returns the contents of the buffer
function.note: Does nothing if no buffers are active

function.name: end_all_clean
function.synopsis: Ends all output buffers and returns their contents
function.note: Does nothing if no buffers are active
